channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid rules in Wales: No outdoor limits and six can meet at home
item.description: Covid rules are relaxed and the law restricting the number people meeting outside is scrapped.

item.title: Covid: Sunshine in Wales puts indoor meet-ups on hold
item.description: Groups of six are now allowed to meet in homes - but not many want to be indoors.

item.title: Clinical Argentina outclass Wales in Cardiff
item.description: Wales end their season with a 33-11 defeat against an impressive Argentina side in the second Test in Cardiff.

item.title: Fire fund 'too little, too late' for high-rise
item.description: Campaigners say plans to pay for fire safety surveys in high-rise flats do not go far enough.

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones returns as Lions thrash Stormers
item.description: The British and Irish Lions complete their Test series preparations with a comfortable win against the Stormers.

item.title: Cardiff's Jewish history brought to life by virtual trail
item.description: The history of the city's Jewish community has been brought to life by a virtual trail.

item.title: Amputee wins better prosthetics funding access in Wales
item.description: David Bradley argued patients in Wales were not getting fair access to better artificial limbs.

item.title: Child sunburn cases at Swansea's Welsh burns hospital prompts warning
item.description: Parents warned to apply sun cream 'liberally' on children as hot temperatures set to soar.

item.title: Cardiff police arrest man, 19, after Bute Park sex assault
item.description: The alleged attack happened in the early hours in one of the biggest parks in Cardiff.

item.title: Llandudno anti-lockdown protest organiser fined £5K
item.description: Protester fined more than £5,000 for organising rally against lockdown and breaching Covid laws.

item.title: Ironman Wales cancelled for 2021 over Covid-19 concerns
item.description: The Ironman Wales triathlon event due to be held in Pembrokeshire is cancelled for the second successive year because of Covid-19.

item.title: One in 360 estimated to have Covid in Wales
item.description: There is an uncertain trend for Covid infections in Wales, as it rises elsewhere in the UK.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid: Why rinks opening in Wales is on ice
item.description: Although ice rinks can re-open from Saturday, Ice Arena Wales will be ready from 1 August.

item.title: Offa's Dyke: 'I needed to get off my backside and do something'
item.description: Jon Moss decided to sell his home and set off on a 177 mile trek across Wales.

item.title: Welsh woman reunited with family after Kuwait prison release
item.description: Sara Assayed returns home after being cleared of drug charges in Kuwait.

item.title: Wedding recreated at care home: 'This is the day I've been waiting for'
item.description: A new bride surprises her grandmother by recreating her wedding in her care home.

item.title: Covid: Bereaved Carmarthenshire survivor questions lockdown easing
item.description: Gwyn Tovey's wife Rita died just weeks after he caught the virus, which led to Long Covid.

item.title: Wales v Argentina: Head coach Wayne Pivac frustrated at mistakes in Pumas defeat
item.description: Wales head coach Wayne Pivac reveals his frustrations at the unforced errors which allowed Argentina to seals a series victory in Cardiff.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Jade Jones 'petrified' second bout of Covid could wreck gold dream
item.description: Jade Jones has revealed she has had Covid-19 and is "petrified" of catching it again during final preparations for the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Athletes 'probably very worried' after positive Covid test in village
item.description: The chief of the Tokyo Olympics accepts athletes are "probably very worried", after a Games-related organiser became the first person to test positive for Covid-19 in the athletes' village.

item.title: T20 Blast: Glamorgan v Hampshire (Sun)
item.description: Preview and squad news as Hampshire Hawks host Glamorgan in the final round of T20 Blast group games.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gareth Baber on the pressure and privilege of coaching Fiji
item.description: Fiji coach Gareth Baber's journey from south Wales to the South Pacific takes in rugby, faith and sacrifice. And, just maybe, Olympic gold.

item.title: Rheolau Covid Cymru yn llacio eto ddydd Sadwrn
item.description: Bydd cyfyngiadau coronafeirws yn dechrau lleddfu wrth i'r wlad symud yn swyddogol i lefel rhybudd 1.

item.title: Gwyliau'r haf yn dechrau gyda thywydd tanbaid yng Nghymru
item.description: Cymru fydd un o'r llefydd poethaf yn y DU dros y penwythnos, gyda disgwyl iddi gyrraedd 33C yn y de.

item.title: Cyfres yr Haf: Cymru 11-33 Ariannin
item.description: Diweddglo siomedig i Gymru yng Nghyfres yr Haf wrth iddyn nhw gael eu trechu yn Stadiwm Principality.

item.title: Gwlad yr Haf yn rhoi cweir i Forgannwg yn y T20
item.description: Y Cymry'n colli o 74 rhediad yng Nghaerdydd, gan ddod â thymor siomedig Morgannwg yn y T20 i ben.
